wikipedia_page.main: Robert Caird FRSE LLD (died 1 December 1915 in Greenock), was a Scottish shipbuilder. He joined the family firm Caird and Company in 1888, later rising to become head of the company.

response: A year after the death of Robert Caird, the company was sold to Harland & Wolff Ltd in 1916 for £432,493. The firm continued trading as a separate enterprise, with Arthur and Patrick Caird on the board, until 1922. The Arthur Street engine works was sold to John G. Kincaid & Company in 1919.
* Robert Caird, head of the company
